content_parts.text: —Solomon was the principal contributor to this collection.
“The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom”
“The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom”
Proverbs is thought to be the foundation for the Beatitudes (
In the first nine chapters, the wisdom of God is personified as a companion of God from the beginning and is revealed in the Second Person of the Trinity, Jesus Christ.
is applied to the Theotokos, the Mother of God, in the Church's Divine Liturgy.
—Hebrew proverbs are often written as individual couplets with two lines of equal length.

Two common types are (1) the synonymous proverb, which expresses the same basic thought in both lines; and (2) the antithetical proverb, which offers a contrast, such as between wise and foolish or virtuous and evil.
The main writings of Solomon reflect the antithetical proverb.
